Hadhrat Mugheera ibn Shu'ba (Radhiallaahu Anhu) narrates that Nabi (Sallallaahu Alayhi Wasallam) once passed by some people, relieved himself and thereafter performed Wudhu, making Masah upon his forehead.' %0D%0AIbn Abbaas (Radhiallaahu Anhu) narrates that Nabi (Sallallaahu Alayhi%0D%0AWasallam) when performing Wudhu gargled his mouth, rinsed his nostrils and%0D%0Aafter washing his face and hands uptil his elbows, he made Masah upon his%0D%0Ahead and ears using both index fingers for the inner portion and the thumbs%0D%0Afor the outside part.' There are lots of Ahaadith indicating to Masah of the%0D%0Aneck, however, all of them are weak. From this, the Fuqahaa state that it is%0D%0AMustahabb to make Masah of the neck.%0D%0A2. If the skin is visible and the water can reach the skin, then this is%0D%0Asparse and it will be compulsory for one to make sure that the water reaches%0D%0Athe skin.
